name: LN Laterality
title: Lymph Nodes Laterality
description: This data item describes whether positive regional lymph nodes are unilateral or bilateral.
notes:
**Note:** **Physician Statement** 
* Physician statement of lymph node laterality can be used to code this data item when no other information is available.
rows:
No regional lymph node involvement
Non-invasive neoplasm (behavior /2)

Unilateral - all positive regional nodes with same laterality
OR only one regional node positive
Bilateral - positive bilateral regional lymph nodes
Laterality unknown - positive regional lymph nodes with unknown laterality

Not applicable: Information not collected for this case
(If this information is required by your standard setter, use of code 8 may result in an edit error.)

Not documented in medical record
Lymph node laterality not assessed or unknown if assessed
additional_info: **Source documents:** pathology report, imaging, physical exam, other statement in record
coding_guidelines:
**1)** Code the appropriate description of involved regional lymph nodes
**2)** **Code 0** when all regional lymph nodes are negative
**3)** **Code 1** when
* **a.** All positive regional nodes are ipsilateral
* **b.** Involved lymph nodes are described as unilateral
* **c.** Only one regional node positive

**4)** **Code 2** when
* **a.** At least one regional lymph node is involved on each side of the body 
* **b.** Involvement is described as bilateral or contralateral

**5)** **Code 3** when regional lymph node(s) are described as positive, but the laterality of the involved nodes is unknown

**6)** **Code 9** when
* **a.** Lymph nodes were not examined or assessed
* **b.** There is no information in the medical record about regional lymph node involvement
* **c.** The status of regional lymph nodes is unknown
rationale: Laterality of regional node metastasis is a Registry Data Collection Variable in AJCC.  This data item was previously collected as Vulva, CS SSF #11.
